title: U.S. Journalist Danny Fenster Released by Myanmar
sub_head: American sentenced last week to 11 years in prison is expected to be home soon
body:
SINGAPORE—Danny Fenster, a U.S. journalist detained in Myanmar and sentenced last week to 11 years in prison, has been freed and will soon be making his way home, according to the U.S Embassy in Myanmar.
Mr. Fenster, 37 years old, was arrested at Yangon International Airport in May as he was heading back to the U.S. to visit his family. He had been detained at Yangon’s Insein prison while facing charges over five criminal offenses. He was found guilty of three on Friday.
